description.narrative: Strengthening financial sustainability and management effectiveness of the National PA System in Guinea-Bissau.

activity-description.narrative: IBAP to effective manage Cantanhez National Park.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: 1.1 Amount of FBG endowment capital secured after 4 years 1.2 Change in the percentage of SNAP recurrent costs supported by endowment revenues 1.3 Change in the number and variety of revenue sources used across the PA system as measured the UNDP/GEF Sustainability Scorecard 2.1 Existence of PA headquarters with functional office facilities and basic equipment and logistics 2.2 Degree of illegal utilization of key plant species of commercial value as recorded in CNP and its buffer zones per year 2.3 Level of poaching recorded in CNP and its buffer zones per year, using as proxy indicators 2.4 Number (or size) of wildlife populations recorded in CNP 2.5 Number of staff (including women) from IBAP, DGFF, local community members trained for effective oversight of land use and threat reduction in PA buffer zones 2.6 Existence of PA and buffer zone management bodies 2.7 Level of satisfaction of local community members (differentiated by gender) collaborating with PA and forest management. 2.8 Increase in cash or in-kind benefits returned to local communities (beneficiaries differentiated by gender) as a result of biodiversity-friendly economic activities 2.9 Management and business plan for CNP and buffer zones updated and under implementation

comment.narrative: 1.1 0 1.2 0 1.3 33% 2.1 No functional office facilities 2.2 To be determined during the first year of project implementation 2.3 To be determined during the first year of project implementation 2.4 To be determined during the first year of project implementation 2.5 0 2.6 No management bodies 2.7 To be determined during the first year of project implementation 2.8 To be determined during the first year of project implementation 2.9 Management plans outdated

1. At least 50 IBAP staff (including women) and local community members trained on effective oversight of land use and threat reduction in protected areas buffer zones 2. Covid-19 preventive measures in the Cantanhez National Park (PNC) and its periphery developed 3. 1 Inventory of the flora and fauna of the PNC completed 4. 2 new members of the general assembly of FBG governance established and functioned 5. Existence of PA and buffer zone management bodies which involve key stakeholders: IBAP, DGFF, and local stakeholders (community councils, CSOs, NGOs) 6. FBG Capitalization and resource mobilization strategy with action plan developed and available 7. community collaborators disaggregated by sex for the management of the PNC forestry ensured 8. 4 annual meetings of management councils organized 9. 85% delivery of effective and efficient project management 10. 4 quarterly reports prepared and available 11. 2 field missions prepared and available 12. 4 minutes of the steering committee prepared and available

1. A total of 52 people (42 men/80% and 10 women/20%) were trained on effective oversight of land use and threat reduction in protected areas buffer zones 2. A massive action of Covid-19 preventive measures was put in place to raise awareness and prevent the pandemic in 159 villages of the PNC targeting around 24,600 village residents 3. 0. It was not carried out due to Covid-19 pandemic. 4. 2 members were recruited and FBG was operational with legal and institutional instruments necessary to mobilize resources for the capitalization of funds 5. The PNCs management structures was improved and operational with increasing performance involving local stakeholders, such as NGOs, CSOs, etc. 6. FBG is operational and has Governance structures, and all the legal-legal and institutional instruments necessary for its operation and to mobilize resources for the capitalization of its fund and especially the fund already committed by the partners. It should be noted that the release of US $ 1.3 million under this project is a precondition by unlocking further funds already promised by some partners, particularly FFEM and Mava Foundation 7. Community collaboration for the management of PNC was satisfactory. Women and young people in particular have their representatives on the Management Board. Many development initiatives are directed preferentially at women because they are more involved in the exploitation of biodiversity resources and more accountable in supporting the family economy 8. 2 meetings were organized and the remaining two cancelled due to Covid-19 pandemic 9. 136% delivery of effective and efficient project management 10. 3 quarterly reports were produced and shared 11. 2 field missions were prepared and shared 12. 2 minutes of the steering committee prepared and shared

1.1 At least 2,284,828 USD 1.2. 5 % 1.3 36 % 2.1 Existence of PA headquarters with functional office facilities and basic equipment and logistics 2.2 Degree of illegal utilisation of key plant species of commercial value as recorded in CNP and its buffer zones per year, to include at least  Red mangrove or “Mangal/Tarafe” (Rhizophora mangle)  “Pó de sangue” (Pterocarpus erinaceus)  African fan palm or “Cibe” (Borassus aethiopium)  African mahogany or “Bissilão” (Khaya senegalensis)  “Poilão” (Ceiba pendandra) 2.3 Level of poaching recorded in CNP and its buffer zones per year, using as proxy indicators  Campbells mona monkey or “Macaco Mona” (Cercopithecus (mona) campbelli )  Bay duiker or “Cabra de mato” (Cephalophus dorsalis)  Bushbuck or “Gazela” (Tragelaphus scriptus)  Crested porcupine or “Porco espinho (Hystrix cristata)  Warthogs or “Porco de Mato” (Phacochoerus africanus) 2.4 Number (or size) of wildlife populations recorded in CNP, to include at least  Leopard (Panthera pardus)  West African Manatee or “Pis-Bus/Manatim” (Trichechus senegalensis)  West African Red Colobus or “Macaco Fidalgo vermelho” (Piliocolobus badius temminckii)  Chimpanzee (Pan troglodytes)  Hippopotamus (Hippopotamus amphibius)  Buffalo (Syncerus caffer) 2.5 Number of staff (including women) from IBAP, DGFF, local community members trained for effective oversight of land use and threat reduction in PA buffer zones 2.6 Existence of PA and buffer zone management bodies which involve key stakeholders: IBAP, DGFF, and local stakeholders (community councils, CSOs, NGOs 2.7 Level of satisfaction of local community members (differentiated by gender) collaborating with PA and forest management. Indicative assessment categories:  Highly Unsatisfactory  Unsatisfactory  Moderately Unsatisfactory  Moderately Satisfactory  Satisfactory  Highly Satisfactory 2.8 Increase in cash or in-kind benefits returned to local communities (beneficiaries differentiated by gender) as a result of biodiversity-friendly economic activities 2.9 Management and business plan for CNP and buffer zones updated and under implementation

1. 2 operational and grants procedures manuals in place for Fundo BioGuine as per international standards 2. 88 people in the forest repopulation of 138 ha in the Cantanhez National Park participated 3. 26.3%. 4. 300 5. 25 6. 50 7. 1 Inventory of the flora and fauna of the PNC completed

1. 0 operational and grants procedures manuals in place for Fundo BioGuine as per international standards; 2. a total of 88 people (9% women and 91% men) participated in the forest repopulation of 138 ha in the Cantanhez National Park 3. 26.3%. 4. A total of 326 participants benefited, of which 94 were women, 62 men, and 170 young from environmental education in Cantanhez Park 5. A total of community 30 people (12 women 40% and 18 men 60%) were trained in the management of improved fireplaces 6. A total of 72 fireplaces were also constructed in communities: Caboxanque (32 fogoes), Cadique Nau (26), and Cadique Maila (14) 7. 0 inventory completed
